channel.title: Futuristic Sounds Radio Show
channel.description: Mr Mikey presents The Futuristic Sounds Radio Show. A blend of futuristic soulful music encompassing broken beats, nu-jazz, underground hip hop plus future and heritage soul and funk. All episodes contain full tracklistings, artist/release information and free downloads.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Broken Beats / Soul / Hip hop
channel.itunes:author: Mr Mikey presents Futuristic Sounds
channel.itunes:summary: Mr Mikey presents The Futuristic Sounds Radio Show. A blend of futuristic soulful music encompassing broken beats, nu-jazz, underground hip hop plus future and heritage soul and funk. All episodes contain full tracklistings, artist/release information and free downloads.

item.title: Futuristic Sounds Radio Show 14 March 2012
item.description: Yes I know it's been a while. But I'm back with another live Deja Vu FM set recorded on March 14th 2012. Future soul, hip hop, jazz, broken. You know the deal. Ain't Misbehavin' (For You) - Chris Turner Poem 4 Randy (Stay Up) - Lady Annalisa Swilkqa Night - Somepling x Mecca :83 Shining Star - Ceclila Stalin Gonna Be Alright - Robert Glasper Experiment feat Ledisi Just Friends - Sara MK Special Kind Of Love - Blaktroniks feat Alicia Renee For The Love - Tensei feat Adad, Yaw and Denmark Can You Feel It - Eric Lau amd Guilty Simpson feat Fatima Seeds - Georgia Anne Muldrow Toe - Julian Dyne Nitegroover - Richard E Edit 1759 - Richard Spaven Blueprint - Jonny Miller Arrival - Domu Consumed - IG Culture Let It Fall (Cecil's Beat Down Mix) - Lady Alma Firecracker - Manwell Dancing in Outer Space - Atmosfear At The Club (Da Capo's Afro Mix) - Timmy Regisford feay Lynn Lockamy Don't Stop (Afronaught 20:20 Edit) - Blakai So Blue And Green - Cecila Stalin Banana Wine - Mo Kolours He Said, She Said (Instrumental) - Eric Lau Please Forgive My Heart - Bobby Womack

item.title: Futuristic Sounds Radio Show 24 August 2011
item.description: A fusion of future soul, hip hop, broken and bass heavy beats. Haezel - This Is Dope [Tokyo Dawn] Colonel Red - Each and Every Way [Tokyo Dawn] Dezaray Dawn - Sail Away [Sol Heir Music] K Banger (IG Culture Remix) - Contact [Holy Roller] Amin Payne - Higher [aminpayne.bandcamp.com] Mark De Clive-Lowe - Hooligan feat Nia Andrews [Tru Thoughts] Africa Hitech - Gangslapp [Warp] Dego - Start A New feat Sharlene Hector [2000Black] Soulparlor - Too Hot feat Stan Smith [Tokyo Dawn] Kaidi Tatham - For All Love In Time [Jazz:Refreshed] Colonel Red - Gimme A Minute feat Ursula Rucker [Tokyo Dawn] Tall Black Guy - Luv Dancing [royayersproject.com] Slow Drag Travelers - Lil Warrior [Dapp Records] Flying Lotus - Drip [Warp] Flying Lotus - Melting [Warp] I-Ced - She's Like Magic [Record Breakin] Applejac - De Ja Vu feat Ramona [applejac.bandcamp.com] For free download/purchase links for the music played on this podcast please visit the post on the Deja Vu FM website http://vulive.co.uk/2011/08/25/futuristic-sounds-radio-show-24th-august-2011/

item.title: Sunday Morning Soul 24 July 2011
item.description: A live 4 hour radio set featuring soul, funk and boogie from yesteryear - not 'anthems' or 'club classics' - the real ish. Includes a guest mix from Vlada Stojanovic, a DJ, radio show host and music lover from Serbia. George Duke - Feel Leon Ware - Phantom Lover Bobby Lyle - Pisces Ned Doheny - A Love Of Your Own Angela Bofill - Love Light Maze feat Frankie Beverley - Lady Of Magic Charles Earland - I Will Never Tell Ramsey Lewis - Something About You The Ohio Players - Heaven Must Be Like This The Ohio Players - Only A Child Can Love The Ohio Players - I Want To Be Free The Dramatics - Welcome Back Home Vlada Stojanovic Guest Mix Shuggie Otis - Me And My Women Willie Hutch - Give Me Some Of That Good Old Love Jerry Butler - Can't Forget About You Baby Congress Alley - Are You Looking The Average White Band - Love Your Life Edwin Birdsong - Pretty Brown Skin Labri Siffre - The Vulture Detroit Emerlads - You're Getting A Little Too Smart Tom Brock - Shake Me, Wake me The Undisputed Truth - Mama I Gotta Brand New Thing The Modulations - I'm Hopelessly In Love Delegation - You've Been Doing We Wrong L.V. Johnson - I Need You I Want You Ike And Tina Turner - Sexy Ida The Fatback Band - Lets Do It Again Lamont Dozier - If You Don't Want To Be In My Life Blue Magic - Let Me Be The One Donny Hathway - Switch Charlston Blue The New Birth - African Cry Arthur Verocai - Pelas Sombras Banda Uniao Black - Black Rio Kool & The Gang - Open Sesame Part 2 The Blackbyrds - Lifestyles Aquarian Dream - It Ain't Watcha Do Earth Wind & Fire - Fantasy Johnny Hammond - Los Conquistadores Chocolates Manu Dibango - New Bell Ramsey Lewis - Slick Ramsey Lewis - Can't Function Brenda Taylor - You Can't Have Your And Eat It Too George Duke - The Once Over George Duke - Brazilian Love Affair Paulinho Da Costa - Lets Get Together Ryo Kawasaki - Trinkets and Things Steve Parks - Moving In The Right Direction Dee Dee Sharp Gamble - I Believe In Love Chocolate Milk - Tin Man Dave Sea - Angel Marvin Gaye - I Want You Kimiko Kasai with Herbie Hancock - Always Charles Earland - Coming To You Live Eighties Ladies - I Knew That Love Artist/Track Title unknown Amy Winehouse - Love Is A Losing Game If you enjoy this podcast please click the 'Like' button...it helps to spread the word. Thanks

item.title: MikeyFuturistic Sunday Morning Soul 22 May 2011
item.description: A live radio session of heritage and future soul, jazz, hip hop and broken beats. Includes new music from Saturn Never Sleeps, Mar, Gretchen Parlato and Muhsinah, heritage soul from George Benson, Leon Ware and Chaka Khan. Tracklisting George Benson - Masquerade George Duke - Feel Leon Ware - Turn Out The Light The Jones Girls - Who Can I Run To TS Monk - Last Of The Wicked Romancers Maxi - Lover To Lover Chaka Khan - Nothing's Gonna Take You Away Keith Barrow - If It's Love That You're Looking For Light Of The World - I Will Always Love You Roy Ayers - Got To Find A Lover DKD - You Know It K15 & Lisa Preston - Emporium Jamiroquai - Black Capricorn Day (Jay Dee Remix) Mara Hruby - It's Alright Gretchen Parlato - Holding Back The Years Acer Maple - Beautiful Obenewa - Put Yourself In My Shoes Taylor McFerrin - The Song I Promised You DJ Jazzy Jeff feat Slum Village - Are You Ready Space Invadas - Give Me The Love Mar - Inglewood Chris Turner - Liquid Love Kendra Ross - It's Ok (Yellowtail Remix) Colonel Red - Baby Saturn Never Sleeps - Tory Jinesis feat Homeboy Sandman - Maestro Madness Stan Sly (Quazedelic) – 2 Be A Star Jose James - Vicadin Amalia - Stop Please Miki Vale feat Georgia Anne Muldrow – Bending Muhsinah feat Baatin - In The Open Space Cadets - Chocolate Heaven Gretchen Parlato - Blue In Green Mara Hruby - Lose Myself Fertile Ground - Black Is Omar - Essensual Bilal - You're All I Need (Feels Like Heaven) Dwele - Down Jimmy New Sector Movements - Anthem Motet & Adam Rock - Serching 2000Black - Got Me Puzzled Just One - Got To Find A Way Incognito - Open For Love (Simon Grey Remix) George Duke - Old Slippers Richard Spaven - Ice Is Nice Roy Ayers - Don't Stop The Feeling Brothers Of Soul - Be Right There Robert Strauss - The Empire Strikes Back Delgui - Smile At The Future

item.title: Futuristic Sounds Radio Show 14 October 2010 with Mahon
item.description:
I was really pleased to have soulful dance duo Mahon as guests in the studio. We showcase their new Human EP and preview a couple of future productions. Full track listing to follow.

Rise - Richard Earnshaw feat Ursula Rucker and Roy Ayers [Groovefinder]
HHC5 Bobby and Melinda - Full Crate [MPM]
Drunken Sailor Jazzz (Henkjazzy & Mr Tilt Remix) - Kahuun feat Sofia Rubina [Bagpak]
I Told You - Soul Parlor feat Colonel Red [Tokyo Dawn]
We Roll - Pete Rock [Nature Sounds]
Play It Cool - One Love Beats [CDR]
Closer - Mahon [R2 Records]
Human - Mahon [R2 Records]
Fade Away - Mahon [R2 Records]
Closer (Kaytronik Insanely Klose Dub) - Mahon [R2 Records]
Free - Trevor Goodchilde [CDR]
Comin2ULIve (Suff Daddy Edit) - Charles Earland [MPM]
Sunrise - Monsieur Greg [CDR]
Forgot The Steel Pans - Dego [2000Black]
I Need Your Love - Erik Rico & Marc Mac [Third Planet Records]
You'll Never Find Find - Mahon [R2 Records]
Closer (AEB Remix) - Mahon [CDR]
In and Out (Original Mix) - Alton Miller [Fatsoul Records]
Indifferent - Mahon [CDR]
Ancestral History - Robert Owens [Compost]
Under The Line - Second Sky [Perfect Toy]
Love Song #1 - Meshell Ndegeocello [Maverick]

Music video for Mahon 'Human', the debut single from the Human EP, out now on R2 Records.

Buy the Human EP

Boomkat

 A must have compilation of future soul music. Click the album cover to preview and buy.

item.title: Futuristic Sounds Radio Show 7 October 2010
item.description:
Blast Off - Dwight Trible & The Life Force Trio [Ninja Tune]
Drunken Sailor Jazzzz (Ortalio Remix) - Kahuun feat Sofia Rubina [Bagpak]
All Bules - MiNdToUcH [CDR]
Sowheretonow (Dexter Remix) - BRZLLL [Melting Pot Music]
Do A Thing - Herbie Hancock [Columbia]
Signs and Wonders - Soul Cycle feat John Robinson [CDR]
Closer Love - Miles Bonny [Melting Pot Music]
Quite Buttery - Count D Bass feat Doom [Gold Dust Media]
Super Woman Theme Song - Cee Lo Green [CDR]
Me & You - 1 O.A.K [HNRL]
Destiny - Erik Rico and Marc Mac [Third Planet Records]
Fast Lane (Ishfaq Remix) - Bilal [CDR]
Parable Of A Shiny Miracle - Coultrain aka Seymour Liberty [CDR]
Train Scene from the documentary 'Cuba Feliz' sung by Miguel Del Morales
Estatica - Marcos Valle [Far Out Recordings]
Give It Up Or Turn It Loose - Dick Hyman [Command]
Tycoon Thug - FS Green [Melting Pot Music]
Linguistics (Ishfaq Remix) - Swede Art feat Black Spade and Harry Moschops [Tokyo Dawn]
Numb - Stephen Rigmaiden [So So Deep]
Can I Take You Home - Mel Sheppard [Z Records]
Sexy Sexy - Everett James [735 Music]
The One - Onra feat T3 [All City Records]
Thursday - Full Crate [Melting Pot Music]
Be Your Thing - Booster [Underdog Records]
Grater Bad - Adam Rock [CDR]
Freedom Flight - Electric Egypt [CDR]
Spellbound - The Bar Kays [Mercury]

 

 

Solid collection of some of the best remixes submitted from Bagpak's Kahuun Drunken Sailor Jazz remix contest. Italy's Suonho delivers a massive 4-on-the-floor mix drenched in a slab of jazz-phat-nastiness. Also hailing from Italy, Henkjazzy and Mr Tilt comes on strong flippin the original into suave jazz-fusion number full of organic elements. Poland's Ortalio then takes the original deep into nu jazz territory keepin the vibe smokey, dark and hazy. Additional remixes come from Brooklyn's Izzy Azwell, UK's Homegroove Project and Paris-based Monsieur Greg - all stellar mixes that give Kahuun's original a unique twist.







BRZZLL is a seven piece fusion band from Antwerp, Belgium. Seven young musicians playing psychedelic jazz and funk with a modern twist. Their new album "Happy Life Creator" (mixed by UK jazz kingpin Ben Lamdin aka Nostalgia 77 (Tru Thougts)) will be released in Autumn 2010. The 7" single 'Sowheretonow' is available now at from Melting Pot Music. Download the Dexter remix here







If you are a regular listener to the Futuristic Sounds Radio Show you will already know how much I admire this man's music. Vocalist, musician, beatmaker, DJ. I first discovered him on this EP. Make sure you check out his website at milesbonny.com








 

Due for release on 24 October. Preview the full EP here



Ishfaq has been blessing things up with great remixes (his broken version of D'Angelo's Left and Right is a classic) for more than a minute. Grab the 'Fast Lane' remix plus more at ishfaq.co.uk



 

Born the only son of a Baptist preacher and registered nurse in St. Louis, Aaron Michael Frison, known to the public as Coultrain, was exposed to a multitude of musical genres starting with gospel, then from Blues to Jazz. He credits his parents, and their upbringing as major attributes to his gift, as well as his stern integrity. The stories Coultrain's father preached would eventually find their way into his own growth and style. The tone his mother carried in her angelic voice would characterize his tone, hence the heavy gospel influence in Coultrain’s vocal texture as well as the message. Sign up here to get a free download of the 'GodMustBeABoogieMan' EP



'Estatica' is the new album from Brazilian Marcos Valle available now on Far Out Recordings. Preview and buy here





Volume 5 of Melting Pot Music's producer series The Hi-Hat Club introduces two of Amsterdam's most promising new beatmakers: Full Crate and FS Green. They deliver a set of forward-thinking and progressive beats. Eggs And Pancakes takes the best of both worlds – well chopped samples and so-called electronics – to express their vision of an instrumental hip-hop album in the year 2010. All I can say is...lekker!!!





Tokyo Dawn Records adds fourteen colorful remixes to Swede:art's highly successful boombap album 'Emotional Colors'. Enjoy these musical repaints from standout producers such as TOKiMONSTA, Andreas Saag, Bravo and Duktus (Brownswood Records), Vienna turntablist stars Waxolutionists, Aroop Roy, Matt Flores, Kidkanevil and Ishfaq who remixed the featured track 'Linguistics'. Release date: 21/10/2010



Everett James began his musical journey 30 years ago in Asheville North Carolina. Born in to a musical family he learned the art from his father and performed with his sister throughout his life. He has evolved in to a composer, songwriter, producer, performer, and entrepreneur with 735 Music LLC a media company aimed at creating and challenging urban alternative music and culture. Since 2000, Everett has built a catalogue of works that he writes, produces, and performs, and engineers at Electronika Studios located in Atlanta, Georgia. Everett plays all the instrumentation on his productions layering instrument track by track. He often plays bass, guitar, keys, and drums through out his projects.  He has recorded with George Clinton, toured with Maseo Parker, hit guitar solos on the stage of the Fillmore West, walked the open mics in the NYC village, and played drums through out Europe with Stacy Epps. He continues to push forward using his training in composition to compose for film and his entrepreneurial skills to establish 735 Music in the market as an innovator in urban alternative culture. Head on over to 735music.com to learn more.




Adam Rock with a serious head nodder of an EP. I love his take on Robert Mitchell's 'Greater Good'. Grab it for free below.





Your feedback is always welcome especially on the promo releases. Thanks for listening and viewing.

Until next time,

Mikey
item.dc:creator: Mr Mikey presents Futuristic Sounds
item.itunes:summary:
Blast Off - Dwight Trible & The Life Force Trio [Ninja Tune]Drunken Sailor Jazzzz (Ortalio Remix) - Kahuun feat Sofia Rubina [Bagpak] All Bules - MiNdToUcH [CDR] Sowheretonow (Dexter Remix) - BRZLLL [Melting Pot Music]Do A Thing - Herbie Hancock [Columbia] Signs and Wonders - Soul Cycle feat John Robinson [CDR] Closer Love - Miles Bonny [Melting Pot Music]Quite Buttery - Count D Bass feat Doom [Gold Dust Media] Super Woman Theme Song - Cee Lo Green [CDR] Me & You - 1 O.A.K [HNRL] Destiny - Erik Rico and Marc Mac [Third Planet Records] Fast Lane (Ishfaq Remix) - Bilal [CDR] Parable Of A Shiny Miracle - Coultrain aka Seymour Liberty [CDR] Train Scene from the documentary 'Cuba Feliz' sung by Miguel Del Morales Estatica - Marcos Valle [Far Out Recordings] Give It Up Or Turn It Loose - Dick Hyman [Command] Tycoon Thug - FS Green [Melting Pot Music] Linguistics (Ishfaq Remix) - Swede Art feat Black Spade and Harry Moschops [Tokyo Dawn] Numb - Stephen Rigmaiden [So So Deep] Can I Take You Home - Mel Sheppard [Z Records] Sexy Sexy - Everett James [735 Music] The One - Onra feat T3 [All City Records] Thursday - Full Crate [Melting Pot Music] Be Your Thing - Booster [Underdog Records] Grater Bad - Adam Rock [CDR] Freedom Flight - Electric Egypt [CDR] Spellbound - The Bar Kays [Mercury]
Solid collection of some of the best remixes submitted from Bagpak's Kahuun Drunken Sailor Jazz remix contest. Italy's Suonho delivers a massive 4-on-the-floor mix drenched in a slab of jazz-phat-nastiness. Also hailing from Italy, Henkjazzy and Mr Tilt comes on strong flippin the original into suave jazz-fusion number full of organic elements. Poland's Ortalio then takes the original deep into nu jazz territory keepin the vibe smokey, dark and hazy. Additional remixes come from Brooklyn's Izzy Azwell, UK's Homegroove Project and Paris-based Monsieur Greg - all stellar mixes that give Kahuun's original a unique twist.
BRZZLL is a seven piece fusion band from Antwerp, Belgium. Seven young musicians playing psychedelic jazz and funk with a modern twist. Their new album "Happy Life Creator" (mixed by UK jazz kingpin Ben Lamdin aka Nostalgia 77 (Tru Thougts)) will be released in Autumn 2010. The 7" single 'Sowheretonow' is available now at from Melting Pot Music. Download the Dexter remix here
If you are a regular listener to the Futuristic Sounds Radio Show you will already know how much I admire this man's music. Vocalist, musician, beatmaker, DJ. I first discovered him on this EP. Make sure you check out his website at milesbonny.com
Due for release on 24 October. Preview the full EP here Ishfaq has been blessing things up with great remixes (his broken version of D'Angelo's Left and Right is a classic) for more than a minute. Grab the 'Fast Lane' remix plus more at ishfaq.co.uk
Born the only son of a Baptist preacher and registered nurse in St. Louis, Aaron Michael Frison, known to the public as Coultrain, was exposed to a multitude of musical genres starting with gospel, then from Blues to Jazz. He credits his parents, and their upbringing as major attributes to his gift, as well as his stern integrity. The stories Coultrain's father preached would eventually find their way into his own growth and style. The tone his mother carried in her angelic voice would characterize his tone, hence the heavy gospel influence in Coultrain’s vocal texture as well as the message. Sign up here to get a free download of the 'GodMustBeABoogieMan' EP'Estatica' is the new album from Brazilian Marcos Valle available now on Far Out Recordings. Preview and buy here
